resources.string: üí° Turn off when not needed to save battery

Choose how SpeakThat handles multiple notifications: üîÑ Interrupt - Stops current notification and reads new one immediately. Best for urgent notifications. üìã Queue - Finishes current notification, then reads new ones in order. Nothing gets missed. ‚è≠Ô∏è Skip - Ignores new notifications while reading. Simple but you might miss important ones. üß† Smart (Recommended) - Priority apps interrupt, others queue. Perfect balance of urgency and completeness. Smart mode lets you choose which apps are urgent enough to interrupt (like calls, messages) while other apps wait their turn.
Customize how app names are spoken in notifications
Example: X app reads as Twitter

Choose how SpeakThat handles notifications while music/videos play: üéµ Ignore - Speaks over your media. Simple but can be disruptive. ‚è∏Ô∏è Pause - Pauses media completely while speaking. Good for podcasts, but interrupts music flow. üîâ Lower Audio (Recommended) - Temporarily reduces media volume so you can hear both. Most natural experience. üîá Silence - Doesn\'t speak while media plays. Quiet but you might miss important notifications. Lower Audio works like a car radio - it ducks the music down when speaking, then brings it back up. Perfect for music lovers who still want notifications.

Shake to Stop lets you instantly silence SpeakThat by shaking your device: ‚ú® Why it\'s helpful: ‚Ä¢ Stop embarrassing notifications in quiet places ‚Ä¢ Quick control when your hands are busy ‚Ä¢ Works even when screen is off ‚Ä¢ No fumbling for buttons üéØ How it works: ‚Ä¢ Shake your device firmly (like a dice shake) ‚Ä¢ Current notification stops immediately ‚Ä¢ Queued notifications are cleared ‚Ä¢ New notifications work normally ‚öôÔ∏è Customization: ‚Ä¢ Adjust sensitivity for your preference ‚Ä¢ Test your shake strength with the meter ‚Ä¢ Works great for both gentle and vigorous shakers This feature is especially loved by people who get notifications during meetings, movies, or while driving.
Skip notifications that are persistent (ongoing) or silent (no sound/vibration)

üí° Persistent notifications are ongoing (like music controls, navigation, etc.) and silent notifications have no sound/vibration. This option helps reduce notification spam from background services.
Ongoing notifications that don\'t auto-dismiss (music controls, navigation)
Notifications with no sound or vibration
Notifications with minimum or low priority level
Notifications from system apps (Android, Google services)

Wave to Stop lets you instantly silence SpeakThat by waving your hand in front of the device: ‚ú® Why it\'s helpful: ‚Ä¢ Perfect for users who can\'t shake their device ‚Ä¢ Great for phones on desks or mounts ‚Ä¢ Works with one hand ‚Ä¢ No physical device movement needed ‚Ä¢ Accessibility-friendly alternative to shake üéØ How it works: ‚Ä¢ Wave your hand in front of the device (like a magic gesture) ‚Ä¢ Uses the proximity sensor to detect hand movement ‚Ä¢ Current notification stops immediately ‚Ä¢ Queued notifications are cleared ‚Ä¢ New notifications work normally ‚öôÔ∏è Customization: ‚Ä¢ Adjust sensitivity for your preference ‚Ä¢ Test your wave detection with the meter ‚Ä¢ Works great for different hand sizes and distances This feature is especially useful for accessibility, desk users, and anyone who prefers gesture control over physical movement.
This version of SpeakThat! receives updates through your app store (F-Droid, Google Play Store, etc.).
‚Ä¢ Updates are automatically handled by your app store\n‚Ä¢ You\'ll receive notifications when updates are available\n‚Ä¢ No manual download or installation required
If you want automatic updates directly from GitHub, you can download the GitHub version instead. This version is identical but includes auto-update functionality.

SpeakThat! is an open-source Android Notification Reader that announces your notifications aloud using text-to-speech. Perfect for hands-free operation, accessibility, and staying informed while multitasking.

‚Ä¢ Real-time notification reading
‚Ä¢ Customizable voice settings
‚Ä¢ Smart notification filtering
‚Ä¢ App-specific controls
‚Ä¢ Media-aware behavior
‚Ä¢ Notification history
‚Ä¢ Shake/Wave to stop
‚Ä¢ Custom speech formatting
‚Ä¢ Dark/Light theme support
‚Ä¢ Conditional rules for advanced logic and schedules
‚Ä¢ Fully ad-free and offline functionality

Developed with ‚ù§Ô∏è by Mitchi, a solo developer from the UK with over 12 years of experience testing and using notification readers every day.

SpeakThat! was inspired by Touchless Notifications, originally developed by DYNA Logix, and aims to carry forth the legacy of customisable notification readers.

This project was accelerated by AI-assisted programming.
This project is open source and available under the GPL-3.0 License.\n\nYou can view the full license text and source code on GitHub. Contributions and feedback are welcome!

SpeakThat is an open-source Android Notification Reader that announces your notifications aloud using text-to-speech. Perfect for hands-free operation, accessibility, and staying informed while multitasking.

Real-time notification reading, customizable voice settings, smart notification filtering, app-specific controls, media-aware behavior, notification history tracking, Shake to Stop and Wave to Stop, custom speech formatting, dark mode and light mode support, conditional rules for advanced logic and schedules, and fully ad-free, offline functionality.

Developed with love by Mitchi, a solo developer from the UK with over 12 years of experience testing and using notification readers every day. SpeakThat was inspired by Touchless Notifications, originally developed by DYNA Logix, and aims to carry forth the legacy of customisable notification readers. This project was accelerated by Artificial Intelligence assisted programming.
This project is open source and available under the GPL-3.0 License. You can view the full license text and source code on GitHub. Contributions and feedback are welcome!
Your app is up to date!
Download version %s? This will use mobile data if not on WiFi.
Privacy: Update checks only verify version numbers. No personal data is collected or transmitted.
Automatically check for app updates when you open the app
How often should the app check for updates?
Select a pre-configured rule template to get started quickly, or create a custom rule from scratch.
Select your Bluetooth headphones, and notifications will ONLY be read when they are connected to your phone
Select two times you want SpeakThat to remain silent between
Notifications will only be read if your screen is off
Enter your Home WiFi network and notifications will only be read when you\'re connected to it
When not connected to Home WiFi

This will replace your current settings with the imported configuration.\n\nDo you want to continue?

This will reset all settings to defaults and clear notification history.

This action cannot be undone.

Do you want to continue?
All settings have been reset to defaults and notification history has been cleared.

These settings are for users who need granular control over the voice and accent.

99% of users should only change the main Language option.

If you run into trouble, you can always reset to defaults.

Please enable WiFi to select networks.

Unable to automatically detect WiFi networks. Please manually enter WiFi network names (SSIDs) one per line.\n\nNote: You can also try enabling location services and granting location permissions to automatically detect networks.
No WiFi networks found. Please connect to some networks first or manually enter network names.

Keep SpeakThat quiet when your device is in Do Not Disturb, on a call, or using silent or vibrate modes. Toggle each option below.
Choose how SpeakThat behaves in Silent and Vibrate. Keep both quiet, or let Vibrate keep talking while Silent stays muted.
Recommended: Keep both Silent and Vibrate honoured

‚ú® Benefits:

‚Ä¢ Prevents unwanted audio in Silent
‚Ä¢ Optional speech while on Vibrate
‚Ä¢ Matches your meeting/focus needs
‚Ä¢ Works with physical volume buttons
Rule must have at least one trigger
Rule must have at least one enabled trigger
Rule must have at least one action
Rule must have at least one enabled action
A rule with this name already exists
Screen state must be on or off
Time schedule is missing a valid start or end time
Days of week must be numbers from 0 to 6
Master switch action requires enabled true or false
Read this notification using a custom speech format.
Read the app name, but not the notification content.
Read the entire notification, even if it would normally be in private mode.
Tap a placeholder to add it to your format.
Legacy ticker text (older apps only; often empty on modern notifications)
Current date in MMM dd format (e.g., "Dec 15")
Priority level (Min, Low, Default, High, Max)
Battery mode must be above or below
Battery percentage must be between 0 and 100
Charging status must be charging or discharging
Condition is considered met when the battery is above or below a certain percentage.
Condition is considered met when your device is being charged.
Condition will be considered met when a specific word or phrase is found in the notification.
Condition is considered met when a specific app is actively being used.
Please go to General Settings and enable the Accessibility Permission
